action.action-desc: Mr. Reed (for himself and Ms. Baldwin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Education Sciences Reform Act of 2002 and the Educational Technical Assistance Act of 2002 to strengthen research in adult education.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Research in Adult Education Act .

subsection.text: The Education Sciences Reform Act of 2002 (20 U.S.C. 9501 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (8), (9) through (22), and (23), as paragraphs (3) through (9), (11) through (24), and (26), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.header: Adult education; adult education and literacy activities
paragraph.text: The terms adult education and adult education and literacy activities have the meanings given the terms in section 203 of the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act (29 U.S.C. 3272).

subparagraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (9), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), the following:

paragraph.text: The term digital literacy skills has the meaning given the term in section 202 of the Museum and Library Services Act (20 U.S.C. 9101).

subparagraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (24), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), the following:

paragraph.text: Unless otherwise provided, the term student means any elementary, secondary, postsecondary, or adult education student.
in section 111(b)(1) (20 U.S.C. 9511(b)(1)), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting , including adult education after postsecondary study;

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act (29 U.S.C. 3271 et seq.), after the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq.),; and
in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting and adults after children;
in subparagraph (B), by striking and after the semicolon;
by redesignating subparagraph (C) as subparagraph (D); and
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:

subparagraph.text: access to, and opportunities for, adult education and literacy activities; and
by inserting adult educators, after professional educators,; and
by inserting State directors of adult education, after postsecondary education executives,;
in subparagraph (C), by striking and after the semicolon;
in subparagraph (D), by inserting and after the semicolon; and

improve the literacy and numeracy skills of individuals who need adult education;
in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in paragraph (10)(D), by striking and after the semicolon;

by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: carry out research on successful State and local adult education and literacy activities that—

subparagraph.text: result in increased literacy and numeracy and educational attainment for adult learners; or
prepare students for postsecondary education or employment.
in subsection (c)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting At least one 1 center shall be assigned the topic of adult education. after paragraph (2).; and

subsection.text: Section 206(b)(2) of the Educational Technical Assistance Act of 2002 (20 U.S.C. 9605(b)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (B) through (F) as subparagraphs (C) through (G), respectively; and
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following:

subparagraph.text: Representatives of local or regional adult education providers.
